subject: Career
title: Skills Audit: What You Actually Know
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Skills Audit: What You Actually Know.

hook.text: She said she had no marketable skills. Then she listed: project management, data analysis, client relations.

buildup.text: Most people underestimate their skills because they take their daily competencies for granted.

discovery.text: A skills audit categorizes abilities into technical, interpersonal, and cognitive â€” then rates proficiency.

twist.text: Skills you find boring might be rare. The thing that's easy for you might be hard for others.

climax.text: Ask five colleagues: 'What do you come to me for?' Their answers reveal your hidden strengths.

punchline.text: You have more skills than you think. Map them to see.

quiz.question: Why do people underestimate their skills?
options: They take daily competencies for granted
